snippet: The Washington school system has begun using videos of the best teachers to help other teachers navigate the evaluation process.
abstract: Washington, DC's public school district hires a reality television company to produce videos intended to improve teachers' skills by allowing them to observe the classroom methods of the district's highest performing teachers; videos, financed by a $900,000 grant from the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, were developed as a complement to district's evaluation system, in which teachers are judged on student test scores and classroom observations.
lead_paragraph: The Washington school system has begun using videos of the best teachers to help other teachers navigate the evaluation process.

headline.seo: Using Video to Teach Washington Teachers
